intro: Myosotis lingulata var. multiflora, commonly known as the multiflora forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features slender, upright stems and produces clusters of small, sky-blue to violet flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
